glsa.title: OpenSSH: Security bypass
glsa.synopsis: A flaw has been discovered in OpenSSH which could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions.

background.p: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol implementation that includes an SFTP client and server support.

description.p: Jan Pechanec discovered that OpenSSH uses a trusted X11 cookie when it cannot create an untrusted one.

impact.p: An attacker could bypass the SSH client security policy and gain privileges by causing an X client to be treated as trusted.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
